alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 12 at 3:48PM MST until January 12 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Central Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 345 PM MST, multiple dangerous snow squalls were impacting areas near Arlington and Elk Mountain, as well as near Medicine Bow and Rock River. Movement of these squalls was generally east at 45 MPH. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 239 and 289. Locations impacted include... Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Battle Mountain, Bosler, Garrett, Friend Park Campground, Wheatland Reservoir 3, and Arlington. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
